intro: Fourniera novae-caledoniae, commonly known as the New Caledonia fiddlewood, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Fourniera novae-caledoniae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
